comments:
In the CVS perspective, I click on "Branches" and see a list of the branches
I've configured.  When I click to expand one of the branches, I get an error
dialog that simply says "Error" and the title of the dialog is "Adding Children"
- nothing more.  At that point, the CVS perspective becomes frozen and I have to
close it and reopen it to unfreeze the perspective.  In the application log, I get:

Nothing I have tried has enabled me to get around this problem, and I am thus
completely unable to checkout any branches other than HEAD.

Details:
I've gotten the same problem on 3.1M3 and 3.1M4.  The above stack traces are
from 3.1M4.  I'm connecting to the CVS via extssh on the default port.  I have
about 20 branches in my branch view - don't know if that is a contributing factor.

I suspect the problem may be due to one of the branch names (since I am able 
to expand branches with no problems). Could you perform the steps at the 
following URL and perform a refresh branches so we can see what your branch 
names are?

http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/%7Echeckout%7E/platform-vcm-
home/docs/online/cvs_features2.0/cvs-faq.html#misc_0

As a workaround, you can check projects out from HEAD and then do a Replace 
with/Another Bracnh or Version (although this may also have problems if ther 
is a corrupt branch tag in your tag list).

Setting up debugging didn't seem to get my anything.  But, if you want to see a
list of my branch names:

So, I blew away all my tags directly in the "repositoriesView.xml" file, and
then re-configured the branches and tags I needed (not all), and it's working
again.  I had tried to remove them all through eclipse but doing so failed to
remove anything.

Marking this as worksforme since we do not have the steps to reproduce. Please 
reopen if it happens again and you can provide us with the steps to reproduce 
the problem.

Also, I was able to remove branch tags using the Configure branches and 
versions dialog so this is also a worksforme. If it is still a problem for 
you, please provide the steps to reproduce the failure.
